intro: Myrsine bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is typically found in moist, tropical environments. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged opposite each other on the stems. Its flowers are clustered in cymes and are often white or pale pink in color. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
